cards.name: Aerie's Pillar
cards.text:
({T}: Add {U}.)
Aerie's Pillar enters the battlefield tapped.
Flying
{2}{U}{U}: Aerie's Pillar becomes a creature in addition to its other types until end of turn.

cards.flavor: “Mass is just energy waiting to happen.”
cards.name: Aether Ascendant

rulings.text: If you have Aether Ascendant become a copy of an instant or sorcery spell, it will no longer be a creature spell and won't enter the battlefield.
Aether Ascendant will be a creature spell until its cast trigger resolves.

cards.text:
Flash
When you cast Aether Ascendant, you may have it become a copy of target instant or sorcery spell. If you do, choose new targets for it. (Instant and sorcery spells don't enter the battlefield.)

cards.name: Almgrove Champion
cards.text:
First strike
Cadence (Whenever you cast a spell, if its mana value is greater than this creature's power, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
Almgrove Champion can only attack or block alone.

cards.flavor: To create a plane is no easy task, and a hundred generations of study requires a hundred forms of categorization.
cards.name: Almgrove Librarian
cards.text: When Almgrove Librarian enters the battlefield, look at the top card of each of your libraries, then for each of those cards, put it on the top or bottom of one of your libraries.

cards.name: Almgrove Sentinel
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may untap Almgrove Sentinel.
{T}: Almgrove Sentinel deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Archive Guardian
cards.text:
When Archive Guardian enters the battlefield, return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
Recite {1}{B}{G} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.name: Ardy, Youthful Geomancer
cards.text:
[+1]: Untap target land.
[-1]: Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card until end of turn. If a land card is exiled this way, you gain 2 life.
[-7]: Untap each land you control. Lands you control become 3/3 Elemental creatures with haste until end of turn. They're still lands.

changes: 2022-07-01 — Has been reworked from freecasting a card with mv less than or equal to the greatest amount of mana you've spent to cast a spell this turn.

2022-05-04 — Freecast mana value limit changed from greatest mana value of spells you've cast this turn to greatest amount of mana spent. Orchestrate changed to cast the spell on next spell resolve from next spell cast.

2022-05-01 — Has been reworked. It now freecasts a card with mv X or less, where X is 1 plus the greatest mv of spells you've cast this turn. It costs {R}{G} and has orchestrate {R}{G}. (Originally {R}{G} Add three mana in any combination of colors. Orchestrate {1}{R}{G}).
2024-03-01 — Casting from exile is now optional.
cards.name: Ardy's Invocation
cards.text:
Create a 1/1 red and green Elemental creature token. Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain haste until end of turn.
Orchestrate {R}{G} (You may exile this card from your hand anytime you could cast a sorcery for its orchestrate cost. When you next resolve a spell, you may cast this from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Ardy's Study
cards.text:
Archive 5 (As this enters the battlefield, shuffle the top five cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
You may play lands from the archived library.

cards.flavor: Rowdy and reckless, the students of the Arpechian Academy are said to be overly inspired by the local wildlife.
cards.name: Arpechian Tiger

rulings.text: You choose the target when Arpechian Tiger attacks, but you decide whether to sacrifice the land when the ability resolves.

cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Arpechian Tiger attacks, you may sacrifice a land. If you do, Arpechian Tiger deals 3 damage to target creature or planeswalker.

cards.name: Arpechian Yatte
cards.text:
Trample
When Arpechian Yatte enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control.
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Arpechian Yatte.

cards.name: Artisan of Marrow
cards.text:
Flash
When Artisan of Marrow enters the battlefield, exile another target creature until Artisan of Marrow leaves the battlefield.

cards.name: Autumn Fae
cards.text:
Flying, double strike
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

changes: 2022-05-04 — Orchestrate changed to cast the spell on next spell resolve from next spell cast. Due to the mechanic change, reworked from giving one creature +3/+3 and Orchestrate—Tap an untapped red or white creature you control.
2024-03-01 — Casting from exile is now optional.
cards.name: Blessing of Valor
cards.text:
Up to two target creatures you control each get +2/+0 and gain first strike and haste until end of turn.
Orchestrate—Tap an untapped red and white creature you control or an untapped red creature you control and untapped white creature you control. (You may exile this card from your hand anytime you could cast a sorcery for its orchestrate cost. When you next resolve a spell, you may cast this from exile without paying its mana cost.)

changes: 2022-05-04 — Orchestrate changed to cast the spell on next spell resolve from next spell cast.
2024-03-01 — Casting from exile is now optional.
cards.name: Bloated Keystone
cards.text:
Target player discards two cards.
Orchestrate {1}{B}{B} (You may exile this card from your hand anytime you could cast a sorcery for its orchestrate cost. When you next resolve a spell, you may cast this from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Breaker of Secrets
cards.text:
When Breaker of Secrets enters the battlefield, each player mills three cards from each of their libraries.
Recite {U} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.name: Bygone Guardian
cards.text:
({T}: Add {W}.)
Bygone Guardian enters the battlefield tapped.
Vigilance
{2}{W}{W}: Bygone Guardian becomes a creature in addition to its other types until end of turn.

cards.name: Cadre Hawk
cards.text:
Flying
When Cadre Hawk enters the battlefield, you may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Cadre Hawk, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you searched a library this way, shuffle.

cards.name: Cavorting Beauty

rulings.text: Cavorting Beauty's ability checks if the spell's mana value is less than its power as the ability triggers and as it tries to resolve. If its power is less than or equal to that spell's mana value at either point, it won't resolve.

cards.text:
Cadence (Whenever you cast a spell, if its mana value is greater than this creature's power, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
Whenever you cast a spell, if its mana value is less than Cavorting Beauty's power, remove a +1/+1 counter from Cavorting Beauty.

cards.flavor: He tracks his marks no matter which side of the grave they step.
cards.name: Ceaseless Stalker
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, if it entered from a graveyard or a player cast it from a graveyard, return Ceaseless Stalker from your graveyard to the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Ceaseless Valiant
cards.text:
Flash
When Ceaseless Valiant enters the battlefield, another target permanent gains indestructible until end of turn.
Recite {1}{W} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

changes: 2023-12-01 — Was 'As Channeling Stone enters the battlefield, choose a card type.' and 'T: Add one mana of any color. Spend this mana only to cast a spell of the chosen type.'
cards.name: Channeling Stone
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color that a basic land you control could produce.

changes: 2022-11-01 — Now costs {4}{G}{U} (from {3}{G}{U}) and no longer draws the card that breaks the mana value chain.
cards.name: Chart the Vast
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. You may exile one that doesn't share a mana value with any cards exiled with Chart the Vast. Put the rest on the bottom of your library. If you exiled a card, repeat this process. Otherwise, put all cards exiled this way into your hand.

cards.name: Clockwork Spellwork
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact is a creature with base power and toughness 3/3 in addition to its other types.
Enchanted artifact has prowess and “Once each turn, when you cast a noncreature spell, you may untap this artifact.”

cards.name: Compulsion's Voice
cards.text:
When Compulsion's Voice enters the battlefield, gain control of target permanent until end of turn. Untap that permanent. It gains haste until end of turn.
Recite {1}{U}{R} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

changes: 2023-08-01 — Can no longer target activated or triggered abilities you control. Its 'draw a card' mode has been moved to the beginning of the effect for clarity.
2022-01-01 — Now exiles itself.
cards.flavor: “What conclusions were you hoping to draw from a sample size of one?”
cards.name: Confirm Hypothesis

rulings.text: If this copies an orchestrate triggered ability, you will cast the card from exile and the original ability will be unable to.

cards.text:
Draw a card, then copy target activated or triggered ability you don't control. You may choose new targets for the copy.
Exile Confirm Hypothesis.

cards.flavor:
“Decay is nothing but creation in reverse.”
—Rahit
cards.name: Conjuring of Locusts
cards.text: Destroy all noncreature, nonland permanents.

cards.name: Corrosive Pact
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one —
• You lose 1 life.
• You draw two cards and you lose 3 life.
• Search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle. You lose 5 life.

changes: 2022-05-04 — Orchestrate changed to cast the spell on next spell resolve from next spell cast.
2021-11-01 — No longer untaps its target.
2024-03-01 — Casting from exile is now optional.
cards.name: Crystal Conjuration
cards.text:
Put three +1/+1 counters on target land. It becomes a 0/0 colorless Elemental creature with haste that's still a land.
Orchestrate—Sacrifice a land. (You may exile this card from your hand anytime you could cast a sorcery for its orchestrate cost. When you next resolve a spell, you may cast this from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: A common quality students are tested on is their ability to perform under pressure. To weave their magic smoothly even under the roughest of conditions.
cards.name: Disruptive Echoes

rulings.text: Disruptive Echoes doesn't enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.text: Permanents enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: A spectacle for mind, body, and soul.
cards.name: Entrancing Virtuoso
cards.text:
Haste
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.flavor: In their search to understand the inner workings of planes, academics turned to the stars.
cards.name: Essence of Constellations
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each other card in your hand.
If you have fewer than seven cards in hand, draw cards equal to the difference.

cards.flavor: Where curiosity is left unfettered, consequences are soon to follow.
cards.name: Exhaustive Research
cards.text: If a player would draw one or more cards, instead that player draws that many cards plus one and loses 1 life.

cards.name: Exhilarating Prescience

rulings.text: You still pay the mana costs of those cards. You can pay any alternate costs.

cards.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, put a lore counter on Exhilarating Prescience.
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of lore counters on Exhilarating Prescience. You may play those cards until your next turn.

changes: 2023-05-01 — Cost reduction now applies at exactly half life as well.
cards.flavor: “Bleakness is the calm before inspiration.”
cards.name: Face the Dawn
cards.text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if your life total is less than or equal to half your starting life total.
Destroy all creatures.

cards.flavor: To bring back what was once real is the first step to bringing about what was never real.
cards.name: False Vitality
cards.text: Put target permanent card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Forgotten Pit
cards.text:
({T}: Add {B}.)
Forgotten Pit enters the battlefield tapped.
Deathtouch
{2}{B}{B}: Forgotten Pit becomes a creature in addition to its other types until end of turn.

cards.flavor: After every duel, its grandeur grows.
cards.name: Giltwork Legacy
Gruff Smith
cards.text:
When Gruff Smith enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact. If you do, that artifact's controller creates a colorless Equipment artifact token with “Equipped creature gets +1/+1” and equip {1}.
Recite {1}{R} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.name: Headwind Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Cadence (Whenever you cast a spell, if its mana value is greater than this creature's power, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

cards.name: Ignition Ritual
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Ignition Ritual deals X damage to each creature and each planeswalker.

cards.name: Ironwood Elemental
cards.text:
Protection from mana values lower than Ironwood Elemental's power (This permanent can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything with mana value lower than this creature's power.)
Ironwood Elemental's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.

cards.flavor: It takes brains to come up with brawn like this.
cards.name: Jara Incarnation
cards.text:
Trample
Other creatures you control have base power and toughness 8/8.

cards.flavor: In Almgrove, knowledge begets power. In Arpechia, power comes from within. In Jara, power simply is.
cards.name: Jara Jadefist
cards.text:
Trample, haste
Cadence (Whenever you cast a spell, if its mana value is greater than this creature's power, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

cards.name: Keystone Conjurer
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, untap target land. If that land is an Animus, it becomes a creature and gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Lodestone Convergence
cards.text:
Whenever a land you control becomes a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}{G}{U}: Target land you control becomes a 3/3 Elemental creature in addition to its other types until end of turn.

cards.name: Lumbering Hillock
cards.text:
({T}: Add {G}.)
Lumbering Hillock enters the battlefield tapped.
Trample
{2}{G}{G}: Lumbering Hillock becomes a creature in addition to its other types until end of turn.

cards.name: Lunar Arbiter

rulings.text: If a player is simultaneously dealt combat damage by multiple creatures, that player will lose life only once (and thus lose only 3 life).
If a player simultaneously gains life from multiple sources (such as lifelink), the replacement effect will still apply to each instance of life gain.

cards.text:
If a player would lose life, that player loses 3 life instead.
If a player would gain life, that player gains 3 life instead.

cards.name: Mechanized Ideal

rulings.text: If you control multiple Mechanized Ideals (or other creatures who's base power or toughness depends on other creatures), their base power and toughnesses will be applied in timestamp order after all others have been determined. If you have two Mechanized Ideals, the one that was played later will have 1 more power and toughness than the other.

cards.text: Mechanized Ideal gets +X/+Y, where X is the highest base power among other creatures you control and Y is the highest base toughness among other creatures you control.

cards.name: Misleading Tactics

rulings.text: Blockers will have already been declared by the time you can cast Misleading Tactics.

cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare blockers step.
After this step there's an additional declare attackers step followed by an additional declare blockers step. (A creature can't attack or block again if it's already attacking or blocking.)
Draw a card.

changes: 2021-08-03 — Is now a perennial trigger.
cards.name: Paternal Pride
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has haste.
Once each turn, when enchanted creature becomes tapped, you may add {R}{R}. Until end of turn, you don't lose this mana as steps and phases end.

cards.name: Possibility Matrix

rulings.text: You choose which card to cast as the ability resolves.

cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top card of each of your libraries.
Put X cards exiled with Possibility Matrix on the bottom of their owner's library: You may cast a nonland card exiled with Possibility Matrix with mana value X or less without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Prismatic Leyline

rulings.text: Prismatic Leyline doesn't care if there are any restrictions on casting or spending that mana. Mana produced by Prismatic Leyline won't have those restrictions.
If that land can't produce colored mana, Prismatic Leyline won't produce mana.

cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color that land could produce.

cards.name: Rahit, Immaculate Architect

rulings.text: A spell with {X} in its mana cost uses the value of X to determine its mana value. A discarded card with {X} in its mana cost uses X=0 to determine its mana value.

cards.text:
[+1]: Each player may draw a card. For each opponent who does, put a loyalty counter on Rahit.
[-1]: Each player draws three cards, then puts two cards from their hand on top of their library in any order.
[-6]: You get an emblem with “Discard a card with mana value X: Counter target spell with mana value X or less.”

cards.flavor: More than most, he grasps the balance between energy, creation, and will.
cards.name: Rahit's Prodigy

rulings.text: If you can't target an instant or sorcery card in your graveyard, the ability will be removed from the stack and you won't discard a card.

cards.text:
Flash
When Rahit's Prodigy enters the battlefield, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand, then discard a card.

cards.name: Rahit's Study
cards.text:
Archive 5 (As this enters the battlefield, shuffle the top five cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top card of any of your libraries on the bottom of the archived library, then you may put any card in the archived library on top of the archived library.

changes: 2021-05-01 — Mana cost has increased to {2}{B}{R} (from {1}{B}{R}).
cards.name: Reckless Festivities

rulings.text: Passing for Reckless Festivities lasts through the entire spell, not just that process.

cards.text: Starting with you, each player either passes or reveals the top card of their library. Each player that revealed a card this way pays life equal to its mana value. If a player can't, that player passes. Then each player who hasn't passed yet puts that card into their hand. Repeat this process until each player has passed.

cards.name: Rousing Rubble
cards.text:
({T}: Add {R}.)
Rousing Rubble enters the battlefield tapped.
Double strike
{2}{R}{R}: Rousing Rubble becomes a creature in addition to its other types until end of turn.

cards.name: Runic Depths
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, scry 1.
Enchanted land has “{G}, {T}: Each player reveals the top card of their library. Each player that revealed a land card this way may put that card into their hand.”

cards.name: Salva Tore
cards.text:
[+1]: Scry 1, then draw a card. You lose 1 life.
[-2]: Target player sacrifices a creature, then loses life equal to the greatest power among creatures they control.
[-5]: Choose a nonland card name. Exile all creatures and planeswalkers with that name, then search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. That player shuffles.

cards.name: Salva Tore's Study

rulings.text: Salva Tore's Study's defines which library you draw from. You can't draw from another library with its ability.

If you don't own the archived library (for example, you gained control of the Study), the ability will still trigger. No one will draw a card from the archived library, but you will still lose 1 life.

cards.text:
Archive 5 (As this enters the battlefield, shuffle the top five cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
Whenever you draw a card from another one of your libraries, you draw a card from the archived library and you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor:
“Congratulations; you've made a mess of my notes. I may have agreed to keep the peace, but surely no one will miss one failed thief.”
—Salva Tore
cards.name: Salva Tore's Vexation
cards.text: Salva Tore's Vexation deals X damage to target creature or planeswalker, where X is that permanent's mana value. You gain X life.

cards.name: Scaletongue Mistress
cards.text:
Prowess
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, create a 3/3 red Dragon creature token with flying.

changes: 2022-05-04 — Orchestrate changed to cast the spell on next spell resolve from next spell cast.
2024-03-01 — Casting from exile is now optional.
cards.name: Shatter Facade

rulings.text: Shatter Facade doesn't care how it was cast from exile, only if it was or not.

cards.text:
Destroy target creature if it has mana value 4 or greater. If Shatter Facade was cast from exile, destroy that creature if it has mana value 3 or less instead.
Orchestrate {B} (You may exile this card from your hand anytime you could cast a sorcery for its orchestrate cost. When you next resolve a spell, you may cast this from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: “Let your ambition be laid to rest alongside the rest of you.”
cards.name: Sigil of Radiance

rulings.text: This prevents cards from being exiled from graveyards as a cost, such as Roggar's Frenzy and Cranial Violation.

cards.text: Cards can't leave graveyards.

cards.name: Spellslinger's Gauntlet

rulings.text: You can't pay any alternate costs for the copy, but you can pay any additional costs.

cards.name: Spellsword Elite
cards.text:
Cadence (Whenever you cast a spell, if its mana value is greater than this creature's power, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spellsword Elite: The next noncreature spell you cast this turn costs {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Spellwork Bulwark
cards.text:
Defender, flying
Cadence (Whenever you cast a spell, if its mana value is greater than this creature's power, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spellwork Bulwark: It loses defender and gains hexproof and indestructible until end of turn.

changes: 2022-05-04 — Orchestrate changed to cast the spell on next spell resolve from next spell cast.
2024-03-01 — Casting from exile is now optional.
cards.flavor: Every achievement — from a child's first words to the creation of new planes — stems from an idea.
cards.name: Sprout Thought
cards.text:
Draw a card. Scry 2.
Orchestrate {U} (You may exile this card from your hand anytime you could cast a sorcery for its orchestrate cost. When you next resolve a spell, you may cast this from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Stall Fate
cards.text: Return target spell to its owner's hand. Its controller can't cast spells this turn. (Spells cast before this resolves are unaffected.)

changes: 2022-05-04 — Orchestrate changed to cast the spell on next spell resolve from next spell cast.
2024-03-01 — Casting from exile is now optional.

cards.text:
Stormsurge deals 3 damage to any target.
Orchestrate {R} (You may exile this card from your hand anytime you could cast a sorcery for its orchestrate cost. When you next resolve a spell, you may cast this from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: For a brief moment she saw into another world, and knew success was nearly within reach.
cards.name: Submergence
cards.text: Target player draws a card. Put target spell or nonland permanent that player controls on top of its owner's library.

changes: 2022-05-04 — Orchestrate changed to cast the spell on next spell resolve from next spell cast.
2024-03-01 — Casting from exile is now optional.

cards.text:
Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
Orchestrate {1}{G} (You may exile this card from your hand anytime you could cast a sorcery for its orchestrate cost. When you next resolve a spell, you may cast this from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Thought Blossom
cards.text: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard. You may cast that spell for as long as it remains exiled and you may spend blue and black mana as though it were mana of any color to cast it.

changes: 2022-05-04 — Orchestrate changed to cast the spell on next spell resolve from next spell cast.
2024-03-01 — Casting from exile is now optional.

cards.text:
Target creature gains hexproof and trample until end of turn. If Thunderous Charge was cast from exile, that creature gets an additional +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.text: Target player draws X cards and loses X life.

cards.text:
When Vitality Maestro enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.

changes: 2023-03-01 — Mana cost is now {2} (from {1}) and it costs {5} to untap (from {6}).

cards.name: Warded Tome
cards.text:
Warded Tome doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{T}: Draw a card.
{5}: Untap Warded Tome.

cards.name: Whistling Blades
cards.text:
When Whistling Blades enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature or planeswalker.
Recite {1}{B}{B} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters the battlefield or if it would leave the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: Her assistants are rarely the sharpest ghouls in the shed, but they get the job done.
cards.name: Young Necromancer
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 1/1 black Skeleton creature token.
